title: ViT-A*: Legged Robot Path Planning using Vision Transformer A*
description: Legged robot navigation through data-driven path planning, incorporating neural networks, differentiable planners, and Vision Transformers for efficient handling of varied terrains and obstacles, validated on real quadruped robots.

title: Safe Trajectory Sampling in Model-based Reinforcement Learning
description: Enforcing safety constraints in model-based reinforcement learning, ensuring safe trajectories for real robots by integrating user-specified requirements and employing Gaussian processes to maintain complex predictive state distributions.

title: One-Shot Transfer of Affordance Regions? AffCorrs!
description: Our model, AffCorrs, uses a single reference image with annotated affordance regions to segment semantically corresponding parts within a target scene. It leverages pre-trained DINO-ViT's image descriptors and cyclic correspondences, enabling both intra- and inter-class one-shot part segmentation.

title: Fully Self-Supervised Class Awareness in Dense Object Descriptors
description: The method introduces learning of class-aware dense object descriptors that outperforms previous techniques with more robust pixel-to-pixel matches in multi-object scenarios. An example robotic application is shown - grasping of objects in clutter based on corresponding points.

title: Garbage Collection and Sorting with a Mobile Manipulator using Deep Learning and Whole-Body Control
description: A deep neural network GarbageNet to detect different recyclable types of garbage in the wild, experimentally tested with a Whole-Body Controlled Mobile Manipulator.

title: Handling Joint Limits in Mobile Manipulator Whole Body Control via Reinforcement Learning
description: As part of my MSc Dissertation, improved the performance of a state-of-the-art method for mobile manipulator whole-body control by up to 24% in given custom environments. This was achieved by thorough investigation and simplification of the handcrafted reward signal used to optimize the system.

title: Detection of carcinogenic weeds in aerial images using supervised learning
description: Created a dataset containing carcinogenic weeds (Heliotropium Europaeum) in aerial imagery of farm fields. Applied and developed machine learning models for binary image classification. Developed an image processing algorithm for localization of weeds within the images. Dealt with a limited data and achieved a high recall rate.
